Package algorithms.statistics

Class MultivariateNormalDistribution

java.lang.Object
algorithms.statistics.MultivariateNormalDistribution
public class MultivariateNormalDistribution extends Object
sample from a multivariate normal distribution N(m⃗ ,K) following Strang's SVD in machine learning.
Author:
nichole

    • sampleRandomlyFrom0

      public static double[][] sampleRandomlyFrom0(double[] m, double[][] k, int nSamples) throws no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException, NoSuchAlgorithmException
      sample from a multivariate normal distribution N(m⃗, K) following Strang's SVD in machine learning, that is using sqrt(K) for a factor to the generated unit standard normal distribution.
      Parameters:
      m - vector of means for multivariate distribution.
      k - double array of covariance matrix for multivariate distribution. must be a symmetric positive definite matrix.
      nSamples - number of samples to generate of length m.length. e.g. if m is length 2 and sampleSize is 3, the method returns 3 rows of length 2.
      Returns:
      a fair sampling from a normal distribution N(M, K) os length sampleSize.
      Throws:
      no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException
      NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • sampleRandomlyFrom0

      public static double[] sampleRandomlyFrom0(double[] m, double[][] k) throws no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException, NoSuchAlgorithmException
      sample from a multivariate normal distribution N(m⃗, K) following Strang's SVD in machine learning, that is using sqrt(K) for a factor to the generated unit standard normal distribution.
      Parameters:
      m - vector of means for multivariate distribution.
      k - double array of covariance matrix for multivariate distribution. must be a symmetric positive definite matrix. If it isn't, use MatrixUtil.nearestPositiveSemidefiniteToA() first.
      Returns:
      a fair sampling from a normal distribution N(M, K).
      Throws:
      no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException
      NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • _sampleFrom0

      static double[] _sampleFrom0(double[] u, double[] m, double[][] k) throws no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException, NoSuchAlgorithmException
      sample from a multivariate normal distribution N(m⃗, K) following Strang's SVD in machine learning, that is using sqrt(K) for a factor to the generated unit standard normal distribution. The implementation of the sqrt is from Strang's SVD algorithm and from Wasserman's "All of Statistics", 2.43 Theorem: 
           X = mu + sqrt(sigma)*Z where mu is the mean vector,
     sigma is the covariance, and Z is N(O, I) which is the
     unit standard normal distribution.
      Parameters:
      u -
      m - vector of means for multivariate distribution.
      k - double array of covariance matrix for multivariate distribution. k should be a symmetric positive definite matrix. if it isn't, use MatrixUtil.nearestPositiveSemidefiniteToA() first.
      Returns:
      a fair sampling from a normal distribution N(M, K).
      Throws:
      no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException
      NoSuchAlgorithmException

    • sampleRandomlyFrom1

      public static double[] sampleRandomlyFrom1(double[] m, double[][] k) throws no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException, NoSuchAlgorithmException
      sample from a multivariate normal distribution N(m⃗, K) using the Cholesky decomposition for a factor to the generated unit standard normal distribution.
      Parameters:
      m - vector of means for multivariate distribution.
      k - double array of covariance matrix for multivariate distribution. must be a symmetric positive definite matrix.
      Returns:
      a fair sampling from a normal distribution N(M, K).
      Throws:
      no.uib.cipr.matrix.NotConvergedException
      NoSuchAlgorithmException
